_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan
Executive Summary
WHO IS DSM?
DSM is active worldwide in life science and nutritional products, performance materials and industrial chemicals.  The company creates innovative products and services that help improve the quality of life.  DSM's products are being applied in a wide range of end markets and applications such as human and animal nutrition and health, cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, automotive and transport, coatings, housing and electrical & electronics.  The group has annual sales of approximately $13 billion and employs approximately of 23,600 people around the world. DSM ranks among the global leaders in many of its fields.  DSM is headquartered in the Netherlands, with locations in Europe, Asia and the Americas.

DSM's Corporate SHE Policy
Responsible Care is a worldwide action program set up by the chemical industry to ensure ongoing improvement of the chemical industry's performance in the field of Safety, Health and Environment (SHE) and to promote communication on SHE matters.  DSM considers proper SHE management to be a fundamental part of its operations.  We have incorporated the main SHE elements in a management system that is closely linked to the Responsible Care program and is at the same time based on the ISO 9000 and ISO 14000 standards. DSM's SHE policy clearly states the company's commitment to maintaining a safe, healthy and environmentally conscious workplace.  Our policy objectives are:
A?an accident-free working environment.  DSM is convinced that all accidents can be prevented.
A?no occupational diseases or health problems attributable to DSM's activities.
A?ongoing evaluation and improvement of working methods, processes, products and services to ensure that these are safe and acceptable from the point of view of employees, customers, the community and the environment.
In order to achieve these objectives we have laid down a number of principles that apply throughout the DSM organization:
A?SHE management is just

as important as production, marketing, profitability and product quality.
A?All our sites are subject to the same SHE standards.
A?Each site has its own SHE management system.
A?Each site is subject to regular audits.
A?Each site reports on its SHE performance.
A?Each site actively communicates with the neighboring community.

WHO IS DSM Chemicals North America, Inc.?
The DSM facility in Augusta was originally a joint venture between DSM of The Netherlands and PPG Industries of Pittsburgh, PA.  Founded in 1962, the joint venture's first production facility was a nitrogen fertilizer complex.  In 1964, Nipro, Inc., (the predecessor of today's DSM Chemicals) was organized to manufacture caprolactam, a monomer of nylon used in nylon fiber production.  Subsequent expansions of DSM Chemicals resulted in two additional caprolactam plants in Augusta, in 1974 and 1976, which made DSM Chemicals the largest independent supplier of caprolactam in the U.S.  In 1999 nylon 6 production began at the DSM Augusta site.  In 2007 recycling of nylon carpet to produce caprolactam began at the DSM Augusta site. 
 
WHAT DOES DSM Chemicals MEAN TO AUGUSTA? TO GEORGIA?
The DSM Chemicals plant facilities and sales offices in Augusta mean jobs for approximately 354 persons, with a payroll in excess of $25 million and total sales of approximately $600 million, of which approximately a third are export.  DCNA is actively involved with the local community participating in numerous programs, and just to list a few:  Adopt-a-School program sponsor for two area schools, Adopt-a-Road program, community blood drives, pacesetter status as a supporter of the United Way for the C.S.R.A., River Road Community Advisory Panel, Local Emergency Planning Committee, and routinely conduct an open house for local community members.
  
What is Caprolactam?
Caprolactam is the primary raw material used in the production of nylon 6.  At DSM's Augusta plant caprolactam is stored in heated tanks in the liquid state at

a temperature of 190-200A? F.  Molten caprolactam is shipped to domestic customers, who convert it to nylon 6 for end uses including carpet, tire cord, monofilament (weed eater line and fishing line), engineered plastics, and apparel.  DSM also converts caprolactam to a solid-state flake.  The flake is then packaged for export sales mainly for textile applications (apparel and hosiery).

Oleum
Basic Information
A?Oleum, also known as fuming sulfuric acid, is basically a clear liquid with a slight milky-gray tint and a severely irritating odor.  Exposure to the liquid causes tissue destruction. Oleum is a severe fume hazard.  The fumes are sulfur trioxide, are severely irritating and concentrations over 3 ppm are harmful. 
A?Oleum is used as a sulfating agent, dehydrating agent, in dyes, in explosives, and in petroleum refining.  At DSM it is used to convert our intermediate product to our final product, caprolactam.  After it is neutralized with ammonia, the oleum is in turn converted to ammonium sulfate, a by-product fertilizer.

Five Year Accidental Release History 
There was one release of oleum during the last five years.  The release was 409 pounds. There were no offsite effects from this release but the local emergency management agency was notified.


Chemical Specific Accidental Release Prevention Steps
A?Oleum tank fumes are vented to a scrubber that recovers the fumes.
A?Oleum tanks and pumps are diked to limit spills and the downwind impact of the above scenarios.
A?Oleum is piped to our plant from the nearby supplier, thus, eliminating the risk of spills while unloading from tanker trucks.
A?A spare storage tank is maintained.
 
Ammonia
Basic Information
A?Ammonia is a colorless gas with a very strong pungent odor, that is supplied to DSM as a liquid at high pressure and low temperature via piping.  Ammonia is very irritating to mucous membranes, eyes and skin. Direct contact with liquid ammonia can cause severe burns.  The vapor is extremely irritating

and concentrations over 200 ppm are harmful. 
A?Ammonia is one of the most commonly used chemicals in the United States for a variety of industrial, commercial and agricultural purposes. DSM uses it as a refrigerant and as a raw material to produce aqua ammonia and hydroxylamine.

Five Year Accidental Release History
There have not been any reportable spills or releases of ammonia during the last five years.
 
Chemical Specific Accidental Release Prevention Steps
A?Ammonia inventory was minimized by the removal of an ammonia tank.  Inventory is limited to the contents of piping from our supplier, PCS Nitrogen, located close to our plant.
A?A piping inspection program is utilized to monitor the condition of ammonia piping and repairs are made as determined by these inspections.
 
Aqua Ammonia
Basic Information
A?Aqua ammonia is also known as ammonia water, ammonium hydroxide and household ammonia in very dilute solution.  Aqua ammonia is a colorless liquid with a strong characteristic odor.  Concentrations of solution range up to 30% ammonia in water. Like ammonia, aqua ammonia is very irritating to mucous membranes, eyes and skin.  The vapor is extremely irritating and concentrations over 200 ppm are harmful. 
A?Aqua ammonia is used for a variety of industrial, commercial, agricultural, pharmaceutical and household purposes.  DSM uses it to neutralize oleum and produce a by-product fertilizer, ammonium sulfate.

Five Year Accidental Release History
There have not been any reportable spills of aqua ammonia during the last five years. 
 
Chemical Specific Accidental Release Prevention Steps
A?A spare storage tank is maintained.

Methane
Basic Information
A?Methane, also known as natural gas, is a colorless, odorless, tasteless and highly flammable gas that is lighter than air.  Natural gas is delivered with a strong odorizer to give it a distinctive smell.  Methane can be a simple asphyxiant by displacing oxygen from the atmosphere; otherwise, no acute or long term h

ealth effects are known.  Natural gas can also exist in a liquid state at cryogenic temperatures of -260 degrees F.  In the liquid form it is colorless and non-flammable; however, the cold vapors are visible at the liquid surface and will ignite.  Skin contact with liquid natural gas may cause cryogenic burns or frostbite; tissue damage may result from inhalation of super cooled vapors. 
A?Methane is primarily used as a fuel.  At DSM, it is used in the gaseous state as a fuel and as a raw material to produce hydrogen, an intermediate product.

Five Year Accidental Release History
There were no spills or releases of methane during the last five years .

Chemical Specific Accidental Release Prevention Steps
LNG storage tank has been taken out of service, emptied and purged.  All natural gas used at DSM now is supplied by pipeline.
 
Cyclohexane
Basic Information
A?Cyclohexane is a colorless liquid with a slightly sweet and somewhat pleasing odor. Cyclohexane is very flammable in air even in small volumes.  The flammable vapors are heavier than air and tend to accumulate on the ground rather than disperse.  Cyclohexane is not a listed chemical subject to EPA's Risk Management Plan regulation; however, it is considered the most serious hazard in the DSM plant.
A?Cyclohexane is used in the manufacture of nylon, as a solvent and as a paint and varnish remover.  DSM uses it as a raw material to produce caprolactam.

Five Year Accidental Release History
There were no reportable spills of cyclohexane during the last five years. 

Chemical Specific Accidental Release Prevention Steps
A?Cyclohexane storage tank is surrounded by a containment dike or wall.
A?Cyclohexane storage tank is equipped with fire suppression systems.
A?Cyclohexane storage tank fumes are vented to a recovery system to eliminate emissions.
A?Cyclohexane process areas are equipped with vapor detection systems that will automatically activate a water sprinkler system.
A?Cyclohexane process areas are equippe

d with heat sensors that will automatically activate a water sprinkler system.
A?Cyclohexane process areas are equipped with several containment dikes to limit the impact of spills and the above scenarios.
A?Cyclohexane process vessels and piping in hot service are made of crack resistant stainless steel, welded, x-rayed and hydrostatically tested to the most rigorous standards of the ASME codes.
A?Cyclohexane vapors from vessels and safety valves are vented to a flare to be burned and thus limit any further downwind hazard.
A?Cyclohexane process piping with open ends are capped to prevent inadvertent spills or fires.
A?Cyclohexane storage tank is periodically inspected for any possible flaws.
A?Cyclohexane railcars are purged with nitrogen gas to reduce any explosive hazard.
A?Cyclohexane storage tank vacuum breaker is heated and insulated to prevent pluggage during cold weather.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program
Designing for Safety...
A?Tanks are made of crack-resistant carbon steel, welded, x-rayed and tested per API 620 or 650. 
A?Process data are continuously monitored by computer system alarms to alert operators.
A?System design incorporates multiple layers of protection, that is, redundant safeguards.
A?Operating personnel work in blast proof buildings capable of withstanding nearby fire or explosion.

Maintaining our Plant...
A?Maintenance personnel are trained and highly skilled.
A?Critical equipment including tanks, relief devices, hoses, piping, instruments and shutdown systems are tested and inspected regularly to assure proper operation.
A?Preventive Maintenance program is in place and practiced.
A?Equipment is tested and rechecked by operations after it is worked on by maintenance.

Operating Safely...
A?Operators are trained and certified per OSHA  requirements.
A?Continuous computer and operator monitoring and surveillance.
A?Written operating and safety procedures based on process risk analysis and OSHA standards.
A?Controlled entry to

all operating and storage areas.
A?Work permit system to control hazardous work in operating areas.

Auditing our Operations...
A?Independent audits and reviews:
A?Fire protection
A?Government agencies- DOT, OSHA, US EPA, GA EPD.
A?Internal audits and reviews :
A?ISO9000
A?PSM
A?DSM Headquarters
A?Management Safety Inspections
A?Operator Safety Inspections
A?Prestartup Safety Reviews prior to startup of new or modified equipment in a process area.
A?Process Hazard Analyses.
A?Review of proposed design changes for proper design and complete documentation.
A?Routine safety audits of safe work practices.
A?Investigation of all accidents and incidents to determine the root cause.
 
Emergency Response Program
Training and Preparation...
A?Written plant emergency response plan.
A?Simulation drills conducted regularly.
A?Critiques of drills and actual events.
A?Participation in simulation drills with community responders.
A?Emergency Response Team, varies between 90 - 100 members, available 24 hours per day.
A?Emergency Response Team trained in fire fighting, spill control and first aid.
A?Emergency response equipment, including full fire fighting capabilities, located throughout facility.
If a release does occur...
A?Emergency Response Team activated.
A?Warning devices installed to warn on-site and neighboring personnel with preprogrammed messages.
A?Computer system provides weather conditions and modeling of gas/vapor releases.
A?Preplanned release scenarios available to allow quick preliminary evaluation of impact.
A?Fire monitors and automatic sprinklers provide a water spray to cool tanks and knockdown vapors.
A?Modern spill containment equipment located on site for quick spill containment.
